resources.string: Wygledow is full of interesting green areas
List of historical sites worth seeing in Wygledow
List of most important streets in Wygledow
List of other interesting localizations in Wygledow
Former military airport, today one of the most popular Warsaw parks
Park surrounding Soviet Soldiers Cemetery. Has many species of plants from different sites of Europe
Small green area designed for patients but publicly available
Green sites on Belska street, including greenhouses, experimental fields, gardens
Green areas of Gated Community Marina Mokotow, created on the former esplanade of Fort M
Parcel gardens with flowers, fruit trees and summer houses
Parcel gardens along Zwirki i Wigury Street
Opened in 1950. Burial place of 20000 soviet soldiers
Built in XIX century, one of the inner circle forts of Warsaw Fortress
Stadium of Warsaw Sport Club Gwardia, built in 1948
Streets surrounding Fort M with buildings from early XX century
Tram and bus depot for Warsaw district Mokotow
Created after II World War by Eleonora Reicher
There were three localizations with swimming pools in Wygledow - Warsaw Sport Club Gwardia\'s swimming pools, swimming pool on Spartanska street and on Belska street. Today only the latter is opened
Modern multi-familly houses estate with environmental friendly solutions
Designed in second half of XX century, during Warsaw Fortress creation
Constitutes a border of Wygledow, named after two excellent polish pilots
Named after polish archbishop John Paul Woronicz
Named after Vlachs tribe, during communist rules named after russian cosmonaut Komarov
Together with Raclawicka is one of most important axis of Wygledow, named after Chopin\'s Etude Op. 10, No. 12
